data.title: Slovak Digital Verification Journalist
data.meta_description: L’AFP est une agence d’information globale, assurant une couverture rapide, complète et vérifiée des événements de l’actualité comme des thèmes qui façonnent notre quotidien. Avec un réseau de journalistes sans égal, déployé sur 151 pays, l'AFP est en outre un leader mondial de l’investigation numérique
data.text:
Agence France-Presse is looking for a digital verification journalist to report on disinformation circulating on social media in Slovakia and the Czech Republic.

The role is an exciting opportunity to be part of AFP’s growing team of 140 fact-checking journalists who have taken a leading role in the fight against disinformation across the globe, working in 26 languages.

We are looking for a trained journalist who will work primarily on our Slovak fact-checking site, AFP Fakty, in cooperation with our Czech site.

Applicants must have Slovak as a first language; proven ability to write in Czech would be a strong advantage. Excellent English (C2) and training or experience in journalism are required.

The position is intended for freelancers (solo contractors) able to work remotely. The initial try-out period is six months.

The position requires the ability to easily navigate and explore major social media platforms including Facebook, Telegram, Twitter, TikTok, YouTube, and encrypted chat apps.

We will provide the successful applicant with training in digital verification techniques and tools required to find and debunk disinformation online.

Applicants should send a CV and a motivation letter of less than 500 words to fakty@afp.com by May 15, 2023.

AFP is committed to equal opportunities and greater diversity within its teams. We therefore encourage all applications in order to preserve the wealth of profiles, cultures and languages that constitute the strength of our network.
